Get Started with Azure Key Vault

MarkdownBlockBase.code_block:
<add key="ClientId" value="clientid" /> <add key="ClientSecret" value="clientsecret" />
<add key="SecretUri" value="secreturi" />

ImageItem.internal_link_text: Application Settings displayed in Azure Portal
Application Settings displayed in Azure Portal

MarkdownBlockBase.code_block: makecert -sv mykey.pvk -n "cn=KVWebApp" KVWebApp.cer -b 07/31/2015 -e 07/31/2016 -r pvk2pfx -pvk mykey.pvk -spc KVWebApp.cer -pfx KVWebApp.pfx -po test123

LinkItem.internal_link_text: How to: Create Your Own Test Certificate
How to: Create Your Own Test Certificate

MarkdownBlockBase.code_block:
$x509 = New-Object System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2
PS C:\> $x509.Import("C:\data\KVWebApp.cer")
PS C:\> $credValue = [System.Convert]::ToBase64String($x509.GetRawCertData())
PS C:\> $now = [System.DateTime]::Now
# this is where the end date from the cert above is used PS C:\> $yearfromnow = [System.DateTime]::Parse("2016-07-31")
PS C:\> $adapp = New-AzureADApplication -DisplayName "KVWebApp" -HomePage "http://kvwebapp" -IdentifierUris "http://kvwebapp" -KeyValue $credValue -KeyType "AsymmetricX509Cert" -KeyUsage "Verify" -StartDate $now -EndDate $yearfromnow
PS C:\> $sp = New-AzureADServicePrincipal -ApplicationId $adapp.ApplicationId
